results.title: The Last house on the left
results.creator_credit: Sean S. Cunningham Films, Sean S. Cunningham and Wes Craven
results.brief_description: Historically significant horror film by Wes Craven, is a rape-revenge drama that is unflinching in its depiction of murder, rape, sadism and violence. Despite the poor acting and cheap production values “Last house on the left” has a visceral impact that imparts a sense of dread and loathing upon the viewer. This film, at once derided for its brutality and yet praised for its daring, soon became a cult classic and was consequently, highly influential upon future horror-genre filmmakers. Along with “The Night of the living dead” (Romero, 1968) this film heralded the golden age of horror, ushering in an era of ‘realistic’ depiction of brutality in the American heartland. Contains graphic images and some scenes may disturb.

results.title: The Last flight of Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ron Miller and Charles Jarrott
results.brief_description: When a vintage B-29 bomber strays from its course over the Pacific, its crew - a high-living pilot, a prim missionary and two stowaway orphans - is forced to beach it on an unmapped tropical island. Stranded, they plot their way back to civilization. Stars Elliott Gould, Genevieve Bujold, Ricky Schroder, and Vincent Gardenia.

results.title: The Last detail
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Gerald Ayres and Hal Ashby
results.brief_description: Jack Nicholson stars in another outstanding performance as a hard-bitten professional Navy-man given the loathsome job of escortinga very young sailor to a military prison for a minor crime. Randy Quaid, as the young man, hasn’t begun to live yet, so Nicholson decides to give him a lifetime of experiences in three days!. This results in a drinking, fighting, womanising binge, unparalleled in movie history.

results.title: The Last days of disco [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock, Westerly Films and Whit Stillman
results.brief_description: It is the very early 1980s. Alice (Chloe Sevigny) and Charlotte (Kate Beckinsale) are two ambitious publishing assistants who transform themselves into glamourous disco queens and spend their nights dancing at The Club. That is until their disco-world is turned upside down by a seemingly bisexual lothario, Des (Chris Eigeman), whose involvement with drugs lands him and his money-siphoning friends in trouble with the law. A hilarious tale of tangled romances, friendship and music you just can’t stop dancing to!

results.title: The Last days of Chez Nous
results.creator_credit: Saddleback Productions, Jan Chapman and Gillian Armstrong
results.brief_description: Beth (Lisa Harrow) is a successful novelist who runs her career and inner-city household, “Chez Nous” with great energy and humour, despite her hectic life with her French husband (Bruno Ganz), her carefree teenage daughter (Miranda Otto) and a new boarder (Kiri Paramore). The return of her younger sister, Vicky (Kerry Fox) sparks a chain of events which escalate in the intense heat of an Australian Summer and could spell the last days of “Chez Nous”. Also stars Bill Hunter.

results.title: The Land Before Time
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Don Bluth, Gary Goldman and John Pomeroy
results.brief_description: The land before time is an animated tale of dinosaurs who long ago roamed the land that was threatened by earthquakes and volcanoes. A young brontosaurus named Littlefoot sets off in search of the legendary Great Valley where dinosaurs can thrive and live in peace. Along the way he makes friends with four other dinosaurs. During their journey they encounter incredible adventures and obstacles and learn unforgettable lessons about life and what it means to stick together.

results.title: The Lady vanishes
results.brief_description: The plot centres around a British group, en route to England by train from Switzerland. When a dear old lady disappears, a young woman seeks the aid of a fellow passenger to turn sleuth in an attempt to locate her. Something is amiss. Not all the travellers are who they appear to be. Cast: Michael Redgrave, Margaret Lockwood, Dame May Whitty, Paul Lukas, Cecil Parker.

results.title: The Lady from Shanghai
results.brief_description: Orson Welles never played by Hollywood’s rules. This startling film, which begins as a conventional film noir, turns into a sumptuous exploration of the visual possibilities of cinema. The lighting, cinematography, sound and editing have the austerity and beauty of a classical score. Rita Hayworth is the ambiguous centre of the film, a “femme fatale” whose behaviour continually disturbs the expectations of the viewer, as much as it confuses her obsessed lover, Michael (Orson Welles). On its release the film shocked Hollywood. Its eroticism is intense and arousing; the central characters amoral and violent. Initially maligned, the film helped destroy Welles Hollywood career but its power remains undiminished and in Europe it was quickly recognised as one of the masterworks of American cinema. Justly famous for its thrilling climax in a Hall of Mirrors, “The Lady of Shangai” is a rivetting suspense film with moments of dazzling beauty and virtuosity. Based on the novel by Sherman Woods.

results.title: The King of New York
results.creator_credit: Reteitalia, Mary Kane, Vittorio Squillante and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: Christopher Walken stars as a drug lord turned good guy in this crime film directed by Abel Ferrara. Frank White is released from prison, a reformed man and sets out to take over New York City, in order to prevent the closure of a hospital in the South Bronx where he grew up. With the help of a few gangster friends, he begins to take over the entire drug industry in the city, killing those standing in his way. As his takeover begins to succeed he brings in more recruits, but unknowingly starts a underground war between crime groups in the city. Cast also includes Larry Fishburne, Wesley Snipes, David Caruso and Steve Buscemi.

results.title: The King of Marvin Gardens
results.brief_description: Radio personality David Staebler (Jack Nicholson), uses his brother’s life story as fodder for his radio ramblings, thus anticipating the “talk jocks” of the 1980’s and 90’s. David’s brother Jason (Bruce Dern), is full of lofty ambitions but lacks the wherewithal to accomplish them. He has managed to survive for so long thanks to the help of his older brother. His latest vision for success involves building a resort on a small Hawaiian island and he intends to raise the capital by holding a beauty contest and wining and dining rich Japanese businessmen. Along with Jason’s long suffering wife (Ellen Burstyn), David reluctantly agrees to support his brother one more time.
